TXN_HDR_STAFF_ID.description: The ID (a sequential 3 digit base 62 number generated by the system) of the STAFF PERSON.

IDENTIFIER.description: ID - A system generated number used to uniquely identify each ADDRESS. This ID is composed of a base 62 Creation Timestamp and the STAFF_PERSON ID (a sequential 3 digit base 62 number generated by the system).

CITY_NM.description: CITY_NAME - The name of the city for the ADDRESS.

EMRG_TELNO.description: EMERGENCY_PHONE_NUMBER - An alternate or emergency phone number for the  CLIENT.

EMRG_EXTNO.description: EMERGENCY_PHONE_EXTENSION_NUMBER - The emergency phone extension number of the CLIENT.

FRG_ADRT_B.description: FOREIGN_ADDRESS_IND_VAR - This indicator variable is used to indicate if there are any occurrences of FOREIGN_ADDRESSs related to this ADDRESS.

GVR_ENTC.description: GOVERNMENT_ENTITY_TYPE - The system generated number which represents the  specific county (e.g., Napa, Sacramento, Fresno,  etc.) within the state of California for a specific CLIENT's ADDRESS.

MSG_TEL_NO.description: MESSAGE_PHONE_NUMBER - An alternate or message phone number for the CLIENT.

MSG_EXT_NO.description: MESSAGE_PHONE_EXTENSION_NUMBER - The message phone extension number of the CLIENT.

HEADER_ADR.description: OTHER_HEADER_ADDRESS - Any additional address information which will be placed above the standard postal Delivery Address Line. This may include the name of the In Care Of person, firm, institution or building to which the piece of mail is directed.

PRM_TEL_NO.description: PRIMARY_PHONE_NUMBER - The primary phone number including area code of the CLIENT.

PRM_EXT_NO.description: PRIMARY_PHONE_EXTENSION_NUMBER - The primary phone extension number of the CLIENT.

STATE_C.description: STATE_CODE_TYPE - The system generated number which identifies the State for a specific CLIENT's ADDRESS (e.g. California, Hawaii, Texas, etc).

STREET_NM.description: STREET_NAME - The actual name of the street associated with a  specific CLIENT's ADDRESS.  Do not abbreviate if at all possible for matching purposes.

STREET_NO.description: STREET_NUMBER - The street or house number associated with the street name as part of the ADDRESS. This may include the fractional or alphabetic modifier (e.g. A-17, 119-10, 39.2, 100 1/2, etc).

ZIP_NO.description: ZIP_NUMBER - The first five digits of the zip code for ADDRESS.

ADDR_DSC.description: DESCRIPTION - Any additional information pertaining to the  ADDRESS which may include directions for getting  to the ADDRESS, description of the residence, or  foreign phone number, as well as the name and hours (e.g., 3pm to 6pm) of the day care for the child CLIENT who is at the day care center.    If the correspondent ADDRESS TYPE value for this  ADDRESS is 'Homeless', the location of where the  CLIENT lives must be enter here (e.g., shelter care).

ZIP_SFX_NO.description: ZIP_SUFFIX_NUMBER - The last four digits of the zip code for an ADDRESS.

POSTDIR_CD.description: POST_DIRECTION_TEXT_CODE - The two-letter postal abbreviation following the Street Name and Street Suffix which gives directional information about a specific CLIENT's ADDRESS for delivery purposes. For example NE (Northeast), SW (Southwest), etc.

PREDIR_CD.description: PRE_DIRECTION_TEXT_CODE - The two-letter postal abbreviation preceding the Street Name and Street Suffix which gives directional information about a specific CLIENT's ADDRESS for delivery purposes. For example NE (Northeast), SW (Southwest), etc.

ST_SFX_C.description: STREET_SUFFIX_TYPE - The system generated number assigned to each postal standard abbreviation following the Street Name which further identifies the uniqueness of the ADDRESS.

UNT_DSGC.description: UNIT_DESIGNATOR_TYPE - The system generated number assigned for each standard postal abbreviation which further defines the location of a specific CLIENT's ADDRESS (e.g. APT (Apartment), BLDG (Building), FL (floor), etc).

UNIT_NO.description: UNIT_NUMBER - The actual alphanumeric ID following the standard postal abbreviation (UNIT DESIGNATOR) which further defines the position of ADDRESS (e.g. 200A, 2C, etc).

LAT.description: LAT - Latitude is the measurement of distance north or south of the Equator. It is measured with 180 imaginary lines that form circles around the Earth east-west, parallel to the Equator.

LNG.description: LNG - Longitude is the measurement east or west of the prime meridian. Longitude is measured by imaginary lines that run around the Earth vertically (up and down) and meet at the North and South Poles.

ERROR_MSG_TYPE.description:
Message Type can be E- Error, W-Warning, I- Informative,
K-Fatal Error.

ERROR_MSG_CODE.description:
Error Message Code returned from the Mainframe.
For eg 9000 ( Host 9000 Error).

ERROR_MSG_RSN_CODE.description: Error Message Reason Code can point to either a DB2 SQL Error Code or it can hold a Business Rule #. The Business Rule number helps the front end code to decode the reason behind the Error.
